title: Folders and Gmail labels
content: I think I understand the difference between "folders" and Gmail "labels". So, I'm curious. When Thunderbird synchronizes with Gmail, does it create local physical folders for each of the Gmail labels in use, or does it use the Gmail label scheme locally? If a message in Gmail has two different labels attached to it, are there actually two copies of the message created locally in separate folders or not?

title: Spam Bypass Not Working
content:
I just installed the latest Thunderbird 146.0 Win 11.

Configured my server data and Spam settings, etc. Mail coming in and going out OK.

Now I see some messages in the Spam filter that are not Spam. So I click on "Not Spam" button, and the message goes into my Inbox. Great. But after 3-4 seconds, the message is thrown back into the Spam box. I've told it 10 times "Not Spam" and each time it gets moved to the Inbox. Then 3-4 sec later it gets thrown back to the Spam box.

What am I doing wrong? Am I missing a setting?

title: Connection to Comcast Email has Stopped Working
content:
Hello All,

After 7 years Thunderbird is no longer working with my comcast email address. I know this is probably a comcast issue but after more then a week trying to get any sort of help from them I have given up on Comcast and turned here hoping this is some simple issue that someone has seen.

Comcast webmail access works fine

Via Thunderbird - I can send a message although it will not make a copy of the sent message and long after the message is actually sent I am looking at a message in TB that says 'Connecting to imap.comcast.net, which eventually times out telling me it cannot make a copy of the message.

I receive no messages at all

Nothing has changed on my end of the configuration

Any insight or ideas would be appreciated.

My basic Server Settings Are imap.comcast.net Port 995 SSL/TLS Normal Password

Thank you.
creator: markbb10

title: can't download messages
content:
Hi I am using Win 10 and update 140. I updated yesterday.

I have been unable to rebuild my Inbox after doing an Inbox repair. It is having trouble staying connected to my email server, imap.comcast.net. The lower left message continually shifts from Sending Login Info, to Connecting to imap.comcast.net, to Connected, to Opening Inbox folder to looking up imap.comcast.net.

I repaired the inbox because all of a sudden I could not open new messages. I would click on them and it would say loading message but remain blank.

I have also had periodic problems with network and file errors. Just before this happened, I could send a message but not copy it to my Sent folder because of these errors.

If I uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird would it go back to the way it was?

Should I do a system restore?

By the way I am connected online and at a high speed. so that is not the problem

Thank you Richard Higgins Concord MA

I've been trying to connect now for 12 hours and have only recovered a fraction

title: Copies not placed because of "network or file access errors"
content:
I have been using Thunderbird for years for email accounts with Comcast (Xfinity), Yahoo, and gmail. Yesterday, I started having a problem with my Comcast accounts - when I sent a message, it went out, but I got an error message (attached) saying it couldn't save a copy to the Sent folder. Sending messages from my Yahoo account works fine. Sending messages from my gmail accounts, I get _two_ copies in the Sent folder (this is new).

I tried restarting my PC, and that didn't help. I tried Troubleshoot Mode, but that didn't help. I tried reinstalling Thunderbird, and that seemed to fix it, but then it started again. I tried compacting the folders, and that seemed to fix it, but then it started again.

I can connect to the Comast/Xfinity server fine, and things work. If I send an email from the server, a copy goes in the Sent file, and it then shows up in the Sent folder on my desktop. But emails that I send from the desktop don't show up in the Sent folder.

I am using a Dell XPS8950 with Windows 11.

Thank you for your help.
creator: MikeN23

title: is reinstall safe?
content:
I using Win 10 and Thunderbird update 140.

I am unable to download or open messages, except those in folders. Seems to be file access or network errors, although my internet connection is fine and Thunderbird shows I am online. Problem happened after I did an Inbox repair. I have thousands of old messages and wondering if that is the problem.

It stopped downloading messages after about 5000, the latest in my Inbox being from 2020--but when I click on one it says "loading" email (or content), but it never loads, is just blank.

Is it safe or advisable to uninstall and reinstall Thunderbird? Will it pick up my old profile, settings, folders, etc? Or will I have to reconfigure everything?

My mail is stored on Comcast and I have at least 25,000 emails.

Thanks for any help Richard
creator: rihiggins

title: "Profile.ini" will not import into Thunderbird, causes crash
content:
I set up Thunderbird on Debain 13 OS "Trixie" and then migrated (or tried to) my profiles.ini and attendant email folders to Ubuntu 24.04. I have done this before between Linux and even Windows installs, copying the folders over. Usually that is all you need to do to migrate emails and 'set up'. However, migrating from Debian to Ubuntu causes issues, namely the import is rejected by TB. At first, I thought perhaps Debian is using a newer version of Thunderbird and Ubuntu uses an older version, so I upgraded Thunderbird to a newer version. Import of profiles and folders still crash. This is using the profile import tool in TB.

I have a lot of emails via IMAP and it takes a long time to set them up and about ten gigs worth of emails. Is there anything that can be done?
creator: Inukshuk
